title: Background color — background_color
text: background_color() function adjusts background color tag element.

title: Background color — background_color
text: x tag element .style pronoun. color One "primary", "secondary", "success", "danger", "warning", "info", "light", "dark", "body", "black", "white", "transparent" specifying background color tag element.

title: Background color — background_color
code:
library(htmltools) div( .style %>% background_color("light") %>% border_color("primary") %>% text_color("primary"), "Nunc porta vulputate tellus.", "Suspendisse potenti." ) #>
#> Nunc porta vulputate tellus. #> Suspendisse potenti. #>

what: Different values for different browser sizes — breakpoints
title: Different values for different browser sizes — breakpoints
text: functions cascadess accept multiple name-value pairs via .... argument's name specifies breakpoint, browser width. breakpoint, browser width, argument value supercede values specified smaller breakpoints, smaller browser widths. Breakpoints browser device widths enable developing responsive web applications. responsive web application adjust layout style accomodate size user's browser device. web application responsive design allows users constructively interact browser, phone, tablet, device.

title: Different values for different browser sizes — breakpoints
text: extra small (unnamed xs) Specify unnamed value breakpoint use name xs. breakpoint may unnamed. However, specifying multiple breakpoints best practice use xs name. value style always applied unless superceded larger breakpoint. small (sm) Specify value breakpoint using name sm. value style applied viewport least 576px wide, think landscape phone. medium (md) Specify value breakpoint using name md. value style applied viewport least 768px wide, think tablet. large (lg) Specify value breakpoint using name lg. value style applied viewport least 992px wide, think laptop smaller desktops. extra large (xl) Specify value breakpoint using name xl. value style applied viewport least 1200px wide, think large desktops. extra extra large (xxl) Specify value breakpoint using name xxl. value style applied viewport least 1400px wide, think larger desktops.

title: Different values for different browser sizes — breakpoints
text: breakpoints chosen part Bootstrap library cascadess built upon. Bootstrap website goes greater detail design, construction, usage, see https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.3/layout/breakpoints/.

title: Floats — float
text: float() function places element left right side parent element. text inline elements wrap around floated elements. Note, float() effect flex items.

library(htmltools) div( div( .style %>% border_color("danger") %>% float("left"), "Danger!" ), div( "Nam a sapien.", "Phasellus neque orci, porta a, aliquet quis, semper a, massa.", "Phasellus lacus." ) ) #>

title: Font — font_size
text: font_*() functions adjust size, weight, style tag element's font.

title: Font — font_size
code: font_size(x, size)  font_weight(x, weight)  font_style(x, style)

title: Font — font_size
text: x tag element .style pronoun. size One 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 specifying font size, defaults NULL, case argument ignored. sizes follow conventions heading tags, 1 largest font 6 smallest. weight One "bold", "bolder", "semibold", "medium", "normal", "light", "lighter" specifying font weight, defaults NULL, case argument ignored. "bolder" "lighter", font weight changed relative current font weight. style One "italic" "normal" specifying font style, defaults NULL, case argument ignored.

title: Font — font_size
code:
library(htmltools) p( .style %>% text_color("info") %>% font_weight("bold"), "The values above will include more value in v2.0" ) #>

The values above will include more value in v2.0

title: Height — height
text: height() function adjusts tag element's height. Heights specified relative height parent element, element's content, size browser window.

title: Height — height
text: x tag element .style pronoun. size One 25, 50, 75, 100, "auto", "viewport" specifying height tag element. 25, 50, 75, 100, element's height percentage height parent element must also specified. percentages account margins padding may cause element extend beyond parent element. div() %>% height("auto") #>
